1353211222122.content:
Ash awoke, lying on the ground. Had he been knocked out by the remote? Everything felt wrong, as if he was to light and small for his own body. There were these strange pressures on top of his head and something was tickling his legs. He tried to stand up, only to instantly fall flat on his face. He could feel his feet! It was as if his legs ended in a single toe. Ignoring the weird feeling he moved his head to look up and spotted Serena standing about fifteen feet away, a smile on her face and Braixen by her side.

"There is my cute little Kirlia. Did you have a nice nap?", her voice was somewhere between genuine concern and smug superiority. Ash mind latched onto this word. Kirlia? An attack by wild psychic type would certainly explain everything. Why he was blacked out, the weird sensations and why Braixen was standing at the ready. He blocked out all the weird sensations as his mind went battle-mode. Bringing himself to his knees, he swirled his head around to look for the thread, at the same time his hand reached for the pokeballs at his belt.

Something green fell in his field of vision blocking his sight, while his hand found no balls, instead grabbing onto some kind of flap. Touching it felt incredibly disturbing, halfway between cloth, parchment and skin. He swore he could almost feel his touch trough it. He gave it a tug, in an effort to get it off of him. The sudden sharp sting, caused him to cry out in pain: "KIIII !".

The world around him seemed to slow down, as his mind caught up to with what just happened. With dawning horror he looked down and took it all in. He saw the alabaster white limb holding onto a piece of skin-dress of the same color with its only two fingers. The "dress" was continuous from limb to flap and he knew it continued upward to form his face. Beneath it where green legs, ending in a single point as if to mimic a ballerina and the thing in his eyes, was his new hair. He was sure if he where to reach up, he would have been able to feel the two red horn growing out of his skull. He struggled to his feat. Certain of the impossible.
He was the Kirlia.

No, that wasn't quite right. The feeling of wrongness was subsiding, as if now that his brain knew that his body was different, it didn't care anymore and everything was as it should be. Normally that would be quite a concerning development, but Ash had a different problem to focus on. Now that the weirdness was gone he could really feel his body for the first time: the horns on his head, the skin extending to form the dress, the sensation of permanently standing on his tiptoes, all off it. And through this feeling he discovered the second traumatic change of the day. He wasn't the Kirlia.
She was.

In panic and shock she cried out: "KIRLIAAAA!!", only to be meet with a mocking: "Oh you finally figured it out, huh?". Ash swirled around to look at her "friend" and managed to ask a fearful: "Kiir?" (Why?).
"Well to answer your presumed question: because I had the chance, it was basically the perfect opportunity.", seeing Ash's shocked expression, she continued: "I'm not stupid Ash, I know you don't reciprocate my feelings and I talked to Dawn and May. I'm sure at some point you would have grown frustrated with the Kalos-League and just left. Wouldn't you?". Ash, stumped by the accusation, was unable to respond, so Serena continued:"And Ta-da now you never have to leave. You will fit right in, a cute little dancer for our performance-troupe."

With the next sentence her facial expression seemed to take on a more derange look, without actually changing: " You'll never have to worry about dumb badges or stupid tournaments again and can be my best friend forever. Just imagine it." Impatiently Serena continued, raising a pokeball:"So there is one last question remaining: Will you come willingly?" Then Braixen stepped forward, flame igniting on the end of his stick: "Or do I have to force you?"

Feeling panic set in, Ash furiously looked around. Where was Pikachu? Where were her other Pokemon? There! About twenty feet back, partially hidden by the grass she spotted Pikachu's unconscious form, still singed from his presumed defeat at Braixen's paws. And there not even five feet away from him where her cloth and pokeball. If she could get over to Pikachu or her stuff she could... her train of thought was cut of by a jet of flame missing her by a few inches.
"Last chance. What will it be?" came the mocking voice of her former friend.

What will Ash do?

135321122212221.content:
Panic was starting to creep-up on Ash. The overwhelming feeling of wrongness had subsided, but she still felt weird, so feeble and weak. Everything around her seemed bigger and more dangerous. The forrest around the clearing looked darker. The wind felt harsher, brushing against her horns and tousling her skirt, returning some of the wrongness she had been feeling before. But the biggest changes in her perspective where in Braixen and Serena.

At almost twice Ash's height, the girl looked imposing. She was still smiling in a slightly off way, but Ash could feel that she was genuine in her offer. She didn't want to unnecessarily hurt her, didn't want a bad start with her new Pokemon.. The bizarre mix of craziness, hope, malice and genuine concern gave Ash the creeps. But no matter how bad Serena was, Braixen was worse.

Ash had know the fox-like Pokemon since it had been a little Fennekin, had feed it, played with it, petted it, even fought alongside it. Now it stood almost a head taller than her and held a flame pointed squarely at her. The look of cold determination on its face send chills down her new spine. This was the look of a Pokemon that would do its best for its trainer no matter what. Ash had seen such looks often enough on her own Pokemon to know that.

"Three!" came the shout. "Better decide fast, I don't want to hurt you.", the sincerity of her words made it worse, as Ash's slowly awakening psychic-powers caused her to subconsciously take in the whole range of Serena's screwed-up emotions. This in turn influenced the young Kirlias view of both her opponents and her surroundings, causing them to appear more dangerous and twisted.

"Two!", Braixen's glare intensified, causing Ash to take a step back in fear. The pressure the other Pokemon exerted was almost unbearable. It made her want to run away, to curl up and hide from the stronger Pokemon. It were her new-found pokemon-instincts playing havoc with her still human mind. As a Pokemon, a psychic one at that, Ash was able to instinctively understand the strength of other Pokemon in relation to herself. And currently, even though she was an evolved form, her fighting capabilities where barely above a newborn, causing the other Pokemon to appear even more powerful. In the wild these instincts would have been extremely useful, allowing her to avoid danger and pick her battles, but now the overwhelming urge to flee and hide, hindered her ability to think clearly.

Ash clasped her hands, pressing them against her chest, in an effort to calm herself. She had to find a way out of this mess, she had to think, think damn it. But under the icy glare of Braixen her mind always returned to those instinctual option of: "run and hide" and "submit and hope for the best".
She refused to give in. There had to be better options, but she knew fighting would almost certainly do her no good. If only Pikachu where here, he could... Pikachu! Ash had been so overwhelmed, that she completely forgotten. If she could reach him or her other Pokemon in her clothes, she could fight. Now if only she could close the distance...

"One!", Braixens flame flared up, increasing the pressure and driving the more basic instincts back into the forefront of her mind. She had to make a decision fast.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ash whirled around and started running as fast as her now short legs could carry her, desperately trying to close the distance between her and her Pokemon. She felt the fire before she felt it, throwing herself to the ground, managing to avoid the worst of it, and scrambling to her feet. But it had cost her time and the body of a Kirlia, her body, wasn't build for running. So, as she heared the commanding shout of: "Flame Charge!", it was already to late to dodge.

Braixen had closed the gap in an instant, colliding with her at full speed. The pain surging through Ash's body caused her cry out again: "KIIIIII !!", as she was flung forward from the impact. The pain seemed to redouble as she hit the the ground, bounced off and rolled several feet before coming to a stop. Trying to push herself up, her vision blurred and she collapsed back down, retching in pain. Everything inside Ash seemed to scream for her to either run or fight, but as the pain started to fade, she managed to regain her focus.

Looking up through tears, the young Kirlia rejoiced. She could see both Pikachu lying unconscious in the grass and the pokeballs at her belt. Braixens attack had carried her within five feet of both. Ash knew she had only time to do one thing before the the fox Pokemon would reach her again. So she climbed to her still unfamiliar feet and ran to...

1551311.content:
As Ash and Serena looked over the remote, they had to agree it was a rather strange device. There were no clear labels, just buttons, switches, and a few dials of different kinds. The more they looked it over, the more curious and strange the device became.

Eventually, both Fennekin and Pikachu joined their respective trainers as they looked over the item.

"I don't know," began Ash. "Pikachu, what do you make of it?" The little electric mouse just sniffed it for a second before saying, "Pika, pika," which Ash interpreted as confusion.

"Well," began Serena as she took the remote, "I think we could hand it over to one of the professors, maybe they know what-" Accidentally, Serena's finger brushed across something on the remote, causing the remote to start to hum. "Oops," was all Serena could get out before the group was consumed in a bright light. All four covered their eyes, shielding their eyes from the light.

And just as quickly as it came, the light went leaving the two pokemon and humans standing in the same open field. Slowly, the four travelers' eyes adjusted to the regular light of the sun and blinked away the extra spots. Ash was the first to speak. "Pikachu are you okay?" Pikachu, still wiping the brightness from his eyes answered back in a frustrated, "Pika, Pika-Pi!" Ash sighed, grateful that his friend of so many years was fine and good. Turning to Serena, Ash began, "Serena how are yo-" when he suddenly stopped. From the neck down, Serena looked fine, not even her outfit of black sneakers, stockings, and top, and red skirt was hardly even rustled. However, above the neck, Serena was still mostly fine except.

"What's wrong Ash," started Serena as she too finally managed to chase the brief blindness from her eyes. "Why did you-" Both trainers paused for a few brief seconds before speaking.

"Serena," stated Ash calmly, "Do you feel any different?"

"No... not really," stated Serena, though she had to admit that Ash seemed noticeably louder. "Do you feel any different?"

"No, not at all," answered Ash with a sigh. "Um Serena... I think that light did something to you. Serena, I won't be surprised if you don't believe me, but you have Fennekin ears."

Serena panicked for an instant before she yanked for her purse and dug through it until she found her compact mirror. Flipping it open, Serena looked in the mirror and sure enough, as if they had always been there, Serena had two large, orange and red, Fennekin ears sticking out of the side of her head. Her long hair cascaded over the ears with out difficulty and even matched them quite well. If it weren't for the well of concern that was growing in her gut, Serena might just admire her cuteness for a few moments. Letting out a yelp of concern, Serena's panic took her again for a moment as she closed the compact mirror and shut her eyes, hoping it was all a dream. However, Serena took a few moments and composed herself before looking again at the compact, confirming her new reality.

"Ash, I think you're right, but you should know-" began Serena before she was interrupted by Ash. "Don't worry Serena, I'll call Professor Oak or maybe Professor Birch, maybe they know something."

Sighing and taking comfort in Ash's concern for her, Serena spoke, "Thank you Ash, but you should know... you have Pikachu ears."

"What," shouted Ash in surprise, forcing Serena to wince. Reaching up, instead of normal, small human ears like he was used to, Ash was surprised to discover two long, furry appendages. Serena held her compact open to Ash so Ash could examine himself. Sure enough, Ash had two appropriately sized Pikachu ears where his ears should be.

"Not again," moaned Ash as he slouched slightly, remembering the time he accidentally got turned into a Pikachu by a witch.

"Again?" asked Serena.

"It's a long story. Point is, we're in the same boat," answered Ash as he stood up, adjust his shirt slightly, noting it gave him a slight itch. Grabbing the map out of his bag, Ash quickly looked to where the nearest town would be. "The nearest town that might have a long distance phone would be... probably... Laverre City, but that looks like at least 2-3 days walking."

"Don't worry Ash, I'm sure we will be fine," comforted Serena as she put on her backpack and readied herself, not noticing the odd calmness that she exuded. "We'll head to Laverre City and get one of the professors to help us out."

"Sounds like a plan," answered Ash as he finished checking over Fennekin and Pikachu, both of whom seemed unchanged. Both Pokemon were concerned, but happily hoped onto their respective trainers' shoulders. "Alright, let's get going."

"Don't forget the remote," said Serena as she took a gander at Ash. "Just make sure you don't press anything on it. I don't want to change anymore... though, I have to say, you do look rather cute with Pikachu ears."

Ash, surprisingly, blushed as he carefully put the remote in his bag and joined Serena. "Thanks... though I'd prefer handsome than cute. Those Fennekin ears look... cute on you as well." Serena blushed at this compliment as Ash and she slowly made their way towards Laverre City, unaware that this little adventure had only just begun.

"Not again," moaned Ash as he slouched slightly, remembering the time he accidentally got turned into a Pikachu by a witch.

"Again?" asked Serena.

"It's a long story. Point is, we're in the same boat," answered Ash as he stood up, adjust his shirt slightly, noting it gave him a slight itch. Grabbing the map out of his bag, Ash quickly looked to where the nearest town would be. "The nearest town that might have a long distance phone would be... probably... Laverre City, but that looks like at least 2-3 days walking."

"Don't worry Ash, I'm sure we will be fine," comforted Serena as she put on her backpack and readied herself, not noticing the odd calmness that she exuded. "We'll head to Laverre City and get one of the professors to help us out."

"Sounds like a plan," answered Ash as he finished checking over Fennekin and Pikachu, both of whom seemed unchanged. Both Pokemon were concerned, but happily hoped onto their respective trainers' shoulders. "Alright, let's get going."

"Don't forget the remote," said Serena as she took a gander at Ash. "Just make sure you don't press anything on it. I don't want to change anymore... though, I have to say, you do look rather cute with Pikachu ears."

Ash, surprisingly, blushed as he carefully put the remote in his bag and joined Serena. "Thanks... though I'd prefer handsome than cute. Those Fennekin ears look... cute on you as well." Serena blushed at this compliment as Ash and she slowly made their way towards Laverre City, unaware that this little adventure had only just begun.
